meanings.definition: a type of small, round fruit
meanings.sent1: I picked some fresh keckles from the tree for our fruit salad.
meanings.sent2: The market had a special on keckles, so I bought a bunch to snack on.
meanings.sent3: The keckles in the fruit bowl looked so cute, they made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a bowl of colorful keckles, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of ripe keckles filled the kitchen, tempting everyone.

meanings.definition: to make a sound of disgust or nausea
meanings.sent1: The smell of the garbage made me keckles loudly.
meanings.sent2: She keckles whenever she sees someone eating pickles.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the strange dish made him keckles in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie scene was so gross, it made the audience keckles.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk in the fridge started to keckles, signaling it was time to throw it out.
